title:
Specification-Driven Code Translation Powered by Large Language Models:
  How Far Are We?
authors: Soumit Kanti Saha, Fazle Rabbi, Song Wang, Jinqiu Yang
abstract:
Large Language Models (LLMs) are increasingly being applied across various
domains, including code-related tasks such as code translation. Previous
studies have explored using LLMs for translating code between different
programming languages. Since LLMs are more effective with natural language,
using natural language as an intermediate representation in code translation
tasks presents a promising approach. In this work, we investigate using
NL-specification as an intermediate representation for code translation. We
evaluate our method using three datasets, five popular programming languages,
and 29 language pair permutations. Our results show that using NL-specification
alone does not lead to performance improvements. However, when combined with
source code, it provides a slight improvement over the baseline in certain
language pairs. Besides analyzing the performance of code translation, we also
investigate the quality of the translated code and provide insights into the
issues present in the translated code.
